description: The media object associated to the scene. An instance of a scene media.
title: SceneMediaConfig

$eref.description: The options of a media object. An instance of a scene media options object.
$eref.title: SceneMediaOptionsConfig

___autoPlay.description: Does the video need to be played automatically at start ?
___autoPlay.title: Autoplay

___startTime.description: Set the current position (in seconds) of the video playback.
___startTime.title: Start Time

___autoResume.description: Does the video need to be resumed automatically when the page is visible again ?
___autoResume.title: Autoresume

___loop.description: Does the video need to be looped automatically at the end of playing ?
___loop.title: Loop

___autoPause.description: Does the video need to be paused automatically when the page is not visible anymore ?
___autoPause.title: Autopause

___type.description:
The type of the media. Can be :
  • image
  • video
  • grid
___type.title: Type

$eref.description: An instance of the scene media events configuration.
$eref.title: SceneMediaEventsConfig

___onPlay.description: The onPlay event of the media. The action uid or an array of action uids. Works only on video media.
___onPlay.title: onPlay

___onSeeked.description: The onSeeked event of the media. The action uid or an array of action uids. Works only on video media.
___onSeeked.title: onSeeked

___onEnded.description: The onEnded event of the media. The action uid or an array of action uids. Works only on video media.
___onEnded.title: onEnded

___onPause.description: The onPause event of the media. The action uid or an array of action uids. Works only on video media.
___onPause.title: onPause

___fx.description: The FX associated to the media.
___fx.title: FX

$eref.description: The preview object associated to the media. An instance of a scene media preview.
$eref.title: SceneMediaPreviewConfig

___tile.description: The size of a tile, which corresponds to the width and the height of a tile. It will be used with the width and height to compute the value of the {x} and {y} patterns.
___tile.title: Tile

___url.description: The URL for the preview of the media, with a {face} parameter to specify the face when parsing. Only one image per face is authorized, so no other parameter can be specified.
___url.title: URL

anyOf.description: The URL for the preview of the media (only works for images, simple and multi-resolution, not video)
anyOf.title: Preview

$eref.description: The source of a media object. An instance of a scene media source.
$eref.title: SceneMediaSourceConfig

___tile.description: The size of a tile, in case the chosen format is cube. The size corresponds to the width and the height of a face.
___tile.title: Tile

___order.description:
Order of the layout in the cubemap media, ie where are the faces in the media, starting from the top left of the media. Needs to be a 6-char string, constitued with all of the following letter:
  • R for Right
  • L for Left
  • U for Up
  • D for Down
  • B for Back
  • F for Front
___order.title: Order

___format.description:
The format of the media: equi is for an equirectangular resource (the most common one) and cube is for a cubemap resource (less common but more efficient to display). Can be :
  • equi
  • cube
  • flat
  • hotspot
___format.title: Format

___url.description: This property is only set when the media is an image. The file can be local or on a distant server, but must be a valid image format.
___url.title: URL

___levels.description: This property is only set when the media is a video. The files can be local or on a distant server, but must be a valid video format. If the array is composed of multiple URLs, it is considered that there are multiple qualities to consider. Each member is an instance of a scene source level.
___levels.title: Levels

___streaming.description:
The streaming method: either a html5 video (usually .mp4 or .webm), or a dash flux (.mpd). The authorized values are :
  • html5
  • dash
___streaming.title: Streaming

___pattern.description:
The pattern to respect in case of a multi tiles media. Four parameters are authorized:
  • {face} is for the face, in case of a cubemap media
  • {level} is for the level of quality of the tile, in case of a multi resolution media
  • {x} if for the x coordinates of the tile
  • {y} if for the y coordinates of the tile
___pattern.title: Pattern
